item_name: Robbie Basho - Visions of the Country (1978)
notes: 2025-01-06. 12-string fingerpicking & piano w intensity, vulnerability. Vibrato-rich mystical vocal. Hypnotic, shimmering [1978, Windham Hill Records]
Rock, avant-garde musician, producer, Chicago, active 1989-
2025-01-08 (re-listening). Just stunning & first track goes so hard. Glenn Kotche drums. Lyrics occasionally spiritually damaging [2001, Drag City]

item_name: Robbie Basho - The Falconer's Arm I (1967)
notes: 2025-01-20. Vast, expressive 12-string & on one track, flute. Often trancelike, evokes Hindustani classical music. Spiritually elevated [1967, Takoma Records]
2025-01-06. Incredibly mellow. Nice synth key, horn timbres. Night Walk like Blue Nile meets Earthbound OST [2022, City Slang]
2025-01-08. Cool busy programmed drum grooves. Soft vocal. Subtle, relaxed, comfortable [2004, Domino]

item_name: Horse Jumper of Love - Disaster Trick (2024)
notes: 2025-01-08. Great fuzzy guitar melodies, yearning chord changes. Lyrics sometimes juvenile but in a good way. Recorded in Asheville; Karly & MJ of Wednesday guest [2024, Run for Cover]

item_name: Wilburn Burchette - Opens the Seven Gates of Transcendental Consciousness (1972)
notes: 2025-01-12. Passionate, lyrical solo guitar often around drone w plenty echo. Homemade guitar (!) & electronics [1972, Ebos; 2024, Numero Group]
2025-01-17. V clean, spacious, texturally engaging. Elegant production & orchestration. Almost Joni-like vocal. Approachable [2025, Fat Possum]

notes: 2025-03-05 (re-listening). Classic SM; maybe my fave of hers so far. Production natural & fun. Lyrics gloomy & solipsistic. Love it [2018, Fat Possum]

2023-03-25. The 1st recorded (in 1992) but 4th released of 7 Unwound albums. Possibly the least appreciated thereof. Rougher edges & higher energy than later stuff. Same mad riffs. V short. Signs of things to come in the shimmering foreboding Fingertips & v Sonic Youth-like Stuck in the Middle of Nowhere [1995, Honey Bear; 2013, Numero Group]

notes: 2025-02-01. Adventurous techno/Bjork-like pop. Lots of cool twists & turns. Like a less humourous Pop 2 [2025, Young]

2025-02-04. Amazing instrumentation: nylon strings, Casios, loads of percussion, more, blended into something original. Vocals like Adam Green meets Cleveland from Family Guy. Love Takes Miles rules [2025, Partisan]

item_name: Bonnie Prince Billy - The Purple Bird (2025)
notes: 2025-02-20. More country than other BPB I've heard (nice). Good mix of sincerity and humour, light and dark. Wish he didn't sing about skinny dipping etc. [2025, No Quarter]

notes: 2025-02-27. Very pleasant repeating, drifting electronic textures & motifs. Like walking through the park on a misty day. Straight to the study playlist [2022, Moon Glyph]

item_name: Whitney Johnson & Lia Kohl - For Translucence (2025)

notes: 2025-02-28. Delightful twists and turns. Cello, humming/buzzing/urban sounds, cave/splashy percussion drifts in and out. Sometimes less drift more click. Strangely comforting without ever being dull [2024, Moon Glyph]

item_name: Lynn Avery & Cole Pulice - Phantasy & Reality (2024)
notes: 2025-03-25. Gentle piano, sax, electronics. Beautiful soft textures. Like wandering a vast plain in a video game [2024, Moon Glyph]

item_name: Eli Winter - A Trick of the Light (2025)
notes: 2025-05-20. Endearing mix of rustic guitar-forward jazz and sort of instrumental country. Gets way more basic as it progresses. Pedal steel empire continues to expand [2025, Three Lobed Recordings]
Classical guitarist, based in Tokyo, active 20210?-
2025-05-21. Very moving, sometimes playful layered classical guitar pieces. Arrangements of compositions by Hiroshima producer Rei Harakami who passed away in 2011 [2025, musicmine]

item_name: Trembling Blue Stars - Lips that Taste of Tears (1998)
notes: 2026-02-08. Listening after Shazaming The Rainbow. Lyrics from perspective of creepiest ex ever. Run as fast as you can. Zero self awareness. The Rainbow is a banger though [1998, Shinkansen]
Pop/R&B singer/songwriter, based in Copenhagen, active 2014-
2026-02-08. Actually listened to it a lot last year. Underrated trip hop masterpiece. Wise. A cool breeze [2025, Independent Jeep]
